results.title: Director of Product Marketing
results.description:
At Nova Credit, our mission is to power a more fair and inclusive financial system for the world.¬†Nova Credit‚Äôs diverse global team is stitching together the world's credit data into a single network to unlock financial opportunities for immigrants and other populations historically excluded from the credit system. We‚Äôve built a platform that enables lenders to access a single, predictive cross-border credit database to help enable underwriting decisions. We are backed by leading investors including Kleiner Perkins, General Catalyst, and Index Ventures.
¬†
Nova Credit works with some of the world‚Äôs preeminent firms in the credit sector. Our unique product position generates value for a diverse set of constituents, including thousands of consumers, public corporations, and various financial & technology partners globally. This privileged position creates a unique opportunity for marketing to generate significant growth opportunities through a variety of strategies by working closely with leaders across various organizations.¬†
¬†
We‚Äôre looking for a Director of Product Marketing to elevate our brand and product position into a sophisticated, enterprise-grade offering to enable our GTM function to enter hyper-growth. In this role you will fully own the strategy and execution of the entire product marketing function, focusing on building a cohesive B2B narrative for our two (and future) products, solidifying our position as leaders in our product categories, developing exceptional thought leadership, and enabling our sales and marketing campaigns with content that moves our target consumer. At the same time, you will oversee the product marketing strategy for our D2C motion, as we continue to grow our affiliate revenue and expand our existing accounts under the same Nova Credit brand.
¬†
This is a full-time role on the Marketing Team, reporting directly to Nova Credit‚Äôs VP of Marketing.

  • Provide strategic direction for our product marketing function as well as create a cross-functional view of marketing initiatives and campaigns
  • Maintain strong cross-functional relationships and work streams with Product, Revenue, and Engineering to execute product assets and campaigns¬†
  • Build exceptional thought leadership content that (1) educates our prospects/customers, (2) positions Nova Credit at the forefront of the cash flow underwriting movement, and (3) solidifies our expertise in the new-to-country credit market¬†
  • Own and maintain our portfolio of marketing assets, including website, landing pages, sales collateral (below), videos, and more
  • Create collateral that helps our sales team win deals, including pitch decks, one-pagers, proposal documents, use cases, case studies, email copy, and other educational materials¬†
  • Develop a robust framework for maintaining and democratizing product messaging and collateral¬†
  • Leverage product and industry expertise (via customer feedback, user research, GTM market analysis, etc.) to continuously drive customers‚Äô product competency and usage
  • Understand our customers‚Äô needs at a granular level, unearthing the most critical pain points, and be their voice throughout all marketing assets and campaigns
  • Lead product launches and strategic marketing efforts¬†
  • Routinely measure the success of assets and leverage insights to influence future GTM roadmaps¬†



YOUR SKILLSET:
  • Proven experience working with senior leads in a cross-functional capacity to drive projects to completion with a high degree of excellence
  • Experience building product marketing teams and managing various skill sets such as creative, content development, writing, editorial, product management, and design
  • Vision and creativity for impactful storytelling¬†
  • Comfortable working with B2B and D2C audiences, simultaneously
  • Strong project management skills; results-focused with impactful execution and follow-through; highly detail-oriented
  • Ability to translate highly technical B2B products into crisp customer-facing narratives with a focus on driving product education and usage¬†
  • Experience working with early-stage technology companies selling to different customer profiles; ideally in a fast-paced environment; fintech experience preferred
  • 8+ years of B2B product marketing experience
¬†
We consider all elements of compensation as a part of the value we provide to Novans. This may include base salary, equity grants, incentive compensation for eligible roles, professional development, flexible PTO, and tenure rewards. We offer U.S.-based Novans competitive, employer-subsidized medical, dental, and vision plans, in addition to mental health and wellness benefits and a range of other benefits & perks.
¬†
Base Salary Range for U.S.-based candidates: $175,000 - $213,000, dependent on the candidate‚Äôs individual experience, skills, education, location, and qualifications.¬†
¬†
Everyone is welcome at Nova Credit. We are an equal-opportunity employer where our diversity and inclusion are central pillars to our company strategy. We look for applicants who understand, embrace and thrive in a multicultural and increasingly globalized world. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
Location: Fully Remote, UK / Europe

Contract Type: Full time, Permanent, 40 hour week

Interviews: Max 3 stages totalling around 3.5 hours and one stage will be a role play or technical task

Salary: We have benchmarked a base salary in the region of ¬£28k-¬£38k, dependant upon experience and have a competitive commission structure in place that recognises your experience and potential

¬†

Why join us? üëã

If you love technology and also staying on top of the news that matters, you‚Äôll love life at Vable. We‚Äôre on a mission to help our clients become as efficient as possible when it comes to managing huge volumes of information - so that lawyers and business leaders can stay on top of the news that matters, and as a result make faster and better decisions.

Our enterprise news aggregation and alerting platform is used by over 50 global law firms. We are passionate about what we do - particularly, our Sales department. This is where you come in.

Our CEO Matthew is based in Germany, our Head of Customer Success Emily is in Atlanta (USA), our Head of People & Culture Sarah is in Northern Ireland and our Sales Executive Diana is in Dublin.   • We are a small team, with a vibrant startup culture

This is a great opportunity for you if you want to:

ü§∏‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èHave a great amount of trust and autonomy given to you from day one

üåü Have an established product that has proven success

üíö Join a great team, Diana being your manager and the wider Vable team

üé¢ Join a company looking to scale and who understands People are their greatest asset and culture is foremost

üåç Be part of a remote and global team

¬†

The day-to-day job: üë©‚Äçüíª

While the below is not an exhaustive list of your duties, it outlines the bulk of the role on a day-to-day basis.

  • Conduct research to identify new leads and target accounts

  • Use our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system to track progress, schedule activities, and document relevant information on prospective customers
  • You will develop a deep knowledge of the Vable software

¬†

About you: üëÄ

As a successful Sales Development Representative we know you will be an excellent communicator and listener, and will be confident, competitive, and motivated to continue that success. We will also be looking for the following:

  • You will have a sense of coachability and can work independently to apply self-coaching
  • Have empathy and an understanding of different buyer personas
  • You are adaptable and have a drive for curiosity and creativity
  • You have an excellent work ethic and know success is a whole company effort
  • You are able to work effectively within a decentralised team
  • You have passion in what you do and know how to make others feel excited about our product üòä

¬†

To be successful in this role, your values matter just as much as your skills. Does this sound like you? ‚ú®

  • Determination = you love to overcome obstacles
  • Honesty = when dealing with the team and customers
  • Respectfulness = you love being part of a team, and are respectful when you engage in conversations
  • Creativity = you love to find solutions to complex problems and are cooperative by sharing information, knowledge and experience

¬†

Why work for Vable? üå±

  • We are characterised by pace, progress and change, and believe in unlocking everyone‚Äôs potential. Above all, we value the contributions each of our team members make and reward them
  • We encourage constant learning so you can stay sharp and up to date
  • We love and encourage creativity
  • We embrace people who have different opinions, perspectives and personalities and concentrate on the Cultural Add
  • We provide comprehensive healthcare cover, dependant on your type of contract

  • 25 days of paid leave a year plus statutory holidays, which are based on where you live
  • We like our virtual socials and really do like to get to know everyone
  • And last but not least, our clients love us!

¬†

Ready to apply? üíå

  • Great! Send us a CV and complete the application by Thursday 24th November. All applicants are screened by Sarah, our Head or People and Culture and may be called for an interview throughout anytime of the open role. If we think there might be a fit, an intro call will be set up, or we will let you know that we won‚Äôt be proceeding.

¬†

Interview Process üñäÔ∏è

  • Intro Call: You will meet Sarah first on a 30 minute zoom call; you don't need to prepare anything in advance. The idea is to see if it's a good option for both Vable and you. It‚Äôs time to discuss your background a little more and for Sarah to answer any questions about the role, team, company or culture.
  • Interview: If after the intro call, we‚Äôre both excited to proceed, you will be invited to a second stage interview with Matthhew; CEO and Diana; Sales Executive. This interview will cover your experience, behaviours and personal traits. It should take no longer than 1 hour.
  • Final Interview: Will be with Sarah, Head of People and Culture and another applicable manager. This will take no longer than 1 hour and this is the final stage. For most candidates we expect the whole process to be no longer than 3-4 weeks.

¬†

üé• We record all of our interviews, with your permission. It makes it easier as we are globally distributed and various members of the interview panel can rewatch and give you their full attention without having to take notes.

¬†

Vable is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.

results.title: Head of Legal
results.description:
Our health system is broken, and it‚Äôs a huge problem. Costs are rising out of control while the patient experience gets worse. At Sana, we're passionate about fixing this problem by bringing accessible and affordable health plans to small and medium businesses. We've built an innovative team with top talent from across the health insurance and tech industries to create engaging, modern plans for our clients. This allows our customers to offer competitive benefits packages while paying an average of 20% less than traditional plans.
¬†
Sana seeks a Head of Legal to spearhead a variety of legal needs for our growing company. You will be an integral member of the cross-functional leadership team, reporting directly to the Chief Operating Officer with dotted line reporting responsibilities to the Chief Executive Officer and Board of Directors. You will be relied on to provide sound legal advice and strategic decision-making for the company as we expand to new states and broaden the scope of our operations as a payer, provider, and distributor of health care, benefits, and insurance services.
¬†
To excel in this role, you'll need to be a self-starter and problem-solver who enjoys working in a dynamic, fast-paced and collaborative environment, and who welcomes the challenge of tackling the variety of strategic legal issues that arise on a day-to-day basis. As a team of one initially, being able to prioritize effectively while putting scalable systems and processes in place will be key. You look at the role of legal in a startup as an enabler of business strategy and a lens to assess the risk and reward, not a brake pedal on innovation. You‚Äôll be joining a talented, experienced team and be a part of building something from the ground up, helping with corporate initiatives like fundraising and board meetings as well as weighing in on any company initiative that has significant regulatory or legal concerns associated with it.
¬†



What you will do
  • Set the overall strategy, scope, process and day-to-day responsibilities for the legal function at Sana and facilitate all legal matters for the company in alignment with our mission, values, and business objectives while mitigating potential risk.
  • Support the CEO and Finance team in fundraising efforts and other corporate development initiatives.
  • Manage corporate governance matters, including Board materials, consents, minutes, and associated processes and policies.
  • Support the executive team on legal aspects of opportunities or business issues across Operations, Product, Finance, People, Sales, Engineering, InfoSec, and Marketing to achieve our goals.
  • Draft, review, negotiate, and/or offer guidance on a wide variety of legal matters, including but not limited to contract law, state/federal compliance issues, data/privacy regulations, intellectual property, risk assessments, and other HR, employment, or corporate matters.
  • Provide legal expertise on company-wide initiatives, which may require legal research and advice related to various parts of emerging legislation and regulation, and help the company to stay ahead of relevant developments.
  • Manage internal documentation, templates, and processes to enable business owners to self-service for transactional legal matters, such as NDAs, BAAs, forms, contract reviews, and other repetitive, high-volume legal tasks.
  • Represent the company directly and/or manage outside legal counsel in regulatory enforcement, litigation, and contract negotiations as needed.
  • Coordinate and manage the working relationship with outside legal counsel.



About you
  • JD degree from an ABA-approved law school.
  • At least 6+ years of law firm and in-house counsel experience.
  • Prior experience working at start-ups in the healthcare, health insurance, digital health, ERISA, and/or benefits space is preferred.
  • Desire to work in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced remote work environment and provide leadership and counsel as the company continues to scale.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, including communicating complex legal and regulatory considerations to the broader executive team.
  • Excellent judgment and integrity.
  • Values-oriented. You care about making our healthcare system work better for people and business owners.
  • Gritty. You aren‚Äôt worried about getting your hands dirty and working hard when you need to.
  • Comfortable with change. We are a startup and need people who are ok doing things outside of their traditional job description.



Benefits
  • Benefits
  • Competitive salary
  • Stock options¬†
  • Flexible vacation
  • Medical dental and vision Insurance¬†
  • 401k
  • Paid Parental leave
  • Disability leave
  • Wellness program
  • Opportunity for career growth
  • Dynamic start-up environment
About Sana
Sana is a modern health plan solution for small and medium businesses. We use a more efficient financing structure and integrated technology solutions to cut out wasteful spending and get members access to better quality care at lower cost. Founded in 2017, we are an experienced team of engineers, designers and health system operators. We have the financial backing of Silicon Valley venture firms and innovative reinsurance partners. If you are excited about building something new and being a part of fixing our broken healthcare system from the inside, please reach out!

Job Description

We are looking for a US-Based Rockstar data researcher in the healthcare space, who has the clinical and academic background to find & annotate useful data sets. The core aspect of this role is the annotation of clinical notes & other free-text documents - in order to make it easier for software, analytics & data science teams to train natural language processing models.

Key responsibilities:
* Label and annotate clinical notes and other healthcare documents for symptoms, diagnoses, procedures, drugs, allergies, adverse events, vital signs, and lab results
* Extract multiple useful data sets from files, publications, and other sources
* Write clearly to explain the content, values and schema of each data set
* Collaborate with project & release managers to prioritize which data sets to research & annotate
* Communicate gaps in annotation guidelines, edge cases, and suggestions for improvement of the data research and annotation project for the whole team.



Qualifications

Qualifications:

* Based and located in the United States
* Proven healthcare domain expertise - preferably as a clinician, although clinical coders and health data researchers are also welcome to apply
* Strong attention to detail and understanding of detail clinical, operational, and financial healthcare concepts
* Familiarity with the home health industry is preferred
* An advanced degree such as a PhD, MD or similar professional or academic experience is preferred
* Concrete & proven experience in data research, in areas such as data curation, database modeling / querying, statistics, data science or academic research.
* If you are hired and contribute data to our repository, your name, photo & short bio will appear as a contributor on our website - please do not apply if this is problematic.
* A commitment for 40 hours/week is required
* Only individual freelancers please - no agencies, teams, or companies
* This can potentially be a long-term relationship - we are looking to significantly grow our team - and may grow to include other writing or research assignments.
